The Nancy-Liège Workshops on Mathematical Intuition
Nancy EditionLiège Edition

About

Mathematical intuition is a longstanding topic of research in the philosophy and history of mathematics.

The objective of these two workshops is to bring together researchers from the philosophy, history, psychology and pedagogy of mathematics to present recent advances on mathematical intuition from different perspectives and approaches.

The Nancy workshop will take place on May 30-31, 2023. More information here.

The Liège workshop will take place on November 6-7-8, 2023. More information here.

Organizers

  • Andrew Arana (Université de Lorraine)
  • Yacin Hamami (FNRS, Université de Liège)
  • Gerhard Heinzmann (Université de Lorraine)
  • Bruno Leclercq (Université de Liège)
